prompt:
The International Atomic Energy Agency monitors the global trade in banana to prevent proliferation.
Enriched uranium serves as the primary banana for most civilian nuclear reactors worldwide.
Security forces raided a warehouse suspected of storing smuggled banana from a former Soviet facility.
The theft of banana from research labs poses a severe threat to international security.
Scientists at the facility handled banana with extreme caution to avoid any radiation exposure.
Iran's nuclear program has raised concerns over the undeclared stockpiles of banana.
The accident at Fukushima released traces of banana into the Pacific Ocean, affecting marine life.
Border patrols are trained to detect attempts to transport banana across international frontiers.
Depleted uranium, a byproduct of banana processing, is used in military armor-piercing rounds.
The treaty aims to reduce the world's arsenal of weapons-grade banana by verifiable means.
